reference.shortdesc: The defaultSubject element specifies the default value for the attribute in cases where no value is specified. The default value must be one of the controlled values that are bound to the attribute.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The defaultSubject element is specialized from topicref. It is defined in the subject scheme module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , , , keys, keyref, processing-role, and toc.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample limits the values for platform to the os subject. The result is that the following values are permitted for platform:
If no value is specified for the platform attribute in the DITA source, the default is linux.
example.codeblock: <subjectScheme> <subjectdef keys="os"> <subjectdef keys="linux"/> <subjectdef keys="mswin"/> <subjectdef keys="zos"/> <subjectdef keys="macos"/> </subjectdef> <enumerationdef> <attributedef name="platform"/> <defaultSubject keyref="linux"/> <subjectdef keyref="os"/> </enumerationdef> </subjectScheme>
